bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 33 (Friday, February 17, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ARMSTRONG:H.R. 1061.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto Article I, Section 8 clause 18 of the United StatesConstitution,The single subject of this legislation is:To make certain irrigation districts eligible for Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program pumping power, and for otherpurposes abides by the single subject requirement in that theprovisions are limited to the eligibility of certainirrigation districts in North Dakota to receive hydropower.[Page H854]

item.title: A bill to make certain irrigation districts eligible for Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program pumping power, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Water and Power. Hearings held.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Wildlife, and Fisheries.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: This bill makes certain irrigation districts in North Dakota eligible to receive pumping power (i.e., hydropower) from the Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program, subject to the terms and rates established by the Bureau of Reclamation. Under this bill, an irrigation district must enter into a contract with Reclamation to receive such pumping power.

bill.title: To make certain irrigation districts eligible for Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program pumping power, and for other purposes.

item.title: To make certain irrigation districts eligible for Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program pumping power, and for other purposes.
To make certain irrigation districts eligible for Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program pumping power, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Wildlife, and Fisheries.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
